tweets.text: The start of drain clearance works done today by @GroundControlGC for the @EnvAgency in Barton upon Humber clearing hedging and the embankment ready for our channel cutting team to access the main channel. https://t.co/GgfCOoWId9

High tide at Mevagissey this morning. Approx 450mm of additional sea level due to surge from the weather & wave action onto the South coast.  Great to see most properties had heeded @EnvAgency flood warnings and installed their flood boards to stop the sea entering the buildings https://t.co/4mbWArOY9E

tweets.text: @Matthew_Wright @cerivthomas @EnvAgency Matthew. Best river south of the border for many a year. At its peak, 10,000 fish at its peak. The aggregate of marginal losses so many factors that combine to destroy an ecosystem. We are fighting back though, much work to do. https://t.co/6IJTUFWRki

@moogfood @Matthew_Wright @EnvAgency Incredible amount of fish. And to think there was no C&R back then and the river was netted and poached every night on an industrial scale, yet the fish still ran in huge numbers. The rod return was about 600 fish this year.

Please RT: trailers of waste have been found abandoned across the country, putting the environment at risk.

The Joint Unit for Waste Crime is investigating this.

If you've seen anything, contact Crimestoppers anonymously or call 0800 807060. https://t.co/mNMYwK0bd9
Be careful along beaches, promenades and coastal footpaths and roads as large waves can be dangerous. #staysafe https://t.co/E32KKz9wzr

We have issued more flood warnings this morning. At #Bodmin Town Leat heavy rain has fallen and the river is forecast to rise. In Dorset we have issued a warning for #PrestonBeach where we are expecting large, powerful waves. Check if you're at risk: https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15

Today we ran a press briefing alongside @metoffice on flood prospects this winter. Signals of a wetter than average Jan - Feb so now‚Äôs the time to check your flood risk and sign up to our free flood warnings here https://t.co/gfaL38C2kU https://t.co/QJfsnbC3EB

Man from @wessexwater repeats the same old BS. They use sewage overflows because it prevents "homes and businesses from flooding".

No you use sewage sewage overflows because of the under investment in your company infrastructure, because it's cheaper.

https://t.co/OhzsvvuOFz

tweets.text: @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @the_tpa @pow_rebecca So, following yesterday‚Äôs post on Transwaste I decided to run some numbers. If the bales are stacked 4 high (much higher in places) and we have a density of 1t / bale then we are looking at c. 31,500t of bales. Assuming no more https://t.co/EU8HCtzVez

tweets.text: @cerivthomas 6000! My word.... how has it got to be this bad?? @EnvAgency
@EnvAgency https://t.co/5xNU7bHQxw

We've made temporary repairs to the flood defences at #Newland, near #Selby on the lower River #Aire, to ensure they are strengthened for winter. We'll be starting work to build a new #flood defence wall here next year: https://t.co/L4RRGXVy4k https://t.co/pQbVhmQZay
Our Fisheries Enforcement Officers are out patrolling the Canals and pools in the Penkridge area https://t.co/DIy4S6qqap
@tinaonions @ATCLeicester @benvolresponder @LR4x4Response @LeicsCountyHall @BarrowPC @MountsorrelPar1 @EnvAgencyMids Thanks for the update Rob. ^Stacey

Almost five years ago, thousands of homes were flooded during #StormEva. This is just some of what we have done to protect communities since. 

Make sure you're prepared for any #flooding this winter. Check your risk and make a plan üëâ https://t.co/kEo9reCpQy #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/Qchyf28hHK

Infrastructure like the Thames Estuary is critical in managing the impacts of the climate emergency. One of the largest movable flood barriers in the world, it protects 1.3m people and ¬£275bn of property and infrastructure from flooding #AdaptOurWorld #TogetherForNature https://t.co/uQ2n6E9quw

tweets.text: Today we‚Äôve reached a huge project milestone for #Boston! The #BostonBarrier primary gate is now fully operational on its main hydraulics. This means that now, more than 13,000 homes and businesses in the town are better protected from tidal flooding. https://t.co/ArKOG55WR3

tweets.text:
Major problem on the A30...

The @EnvAgencySW has issued a flood WARNING for central Bodmin because the Leat is flooding. 

Also be aware there's difficult driving conditions across mid-Cornwall and the Roseland because of flooded roads. https://t.co/jxRs9lqCFv

We've made temporary repairs to the flood defences at #Newland, near #Selby on the lower River #Aire, to ensure they are strengthened for winter. We'll be starting work to build a new #flood defence wall here next year: https://t.co/L4RRGXVy4k https://t.co/pQbVhmQZay

A productive morning spent getting the daily rainfall observer packs ready for posting, here are just a few of them for Cumbria. Our observers are a dedicated group of volunteers taking measurements every day. @CumbriaRain @metoffice @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/DTM49sr6Lf

#A30 Both Directions between #Bodmin and #CollifordLake is currently CLOSED due to a large amount of debris in the carriageway. @DC_Police  are on scene. Please use an alternative route https://t.co/KjrwCTr9o4

With the Eythrope wetland complete we are now looking forward to watching the site develop over the next few years! Special thanks to Waddesdon Estate, @RiverThameCT, @EnvAgency, @whitehorsecontr and fab volunteers: Adam Price, Sue Faulds and Mark Ritson. https://t.co/iMTNxUMrBj https://t.co/K6iRLQKFlx

Christmas stocking - we've released 26,000 fish into North East rivers and stillwaters to give numbers a boost. 

The festive release saw young fish released in Northumberland, County Durham and Teesside.

Read more: https://t.co/l5WCOOM2Zo

#Christmas #fish #water https://t.co/SnUDgm1ISH

Not our normal @EnvAgency #plastics and #sustainability team day, but still 1 x bag of #microplastics and 2 x buckets of #beachplastics from #watergatebay removed ‚úÖ (Sadly thousands of bucket loads still remain..) https://t.co/vj3HUkjIZl

It's little things that make our collective efforts worthwhile.
Spur us on to achieve more.
An Otter in the Irwell at Adelphi in the centre of Salford
HOW AMAZING IS THAT
@salford_mayor @salforduni @SalfordVRangers @natural_course @EnvAgencyNW @MarkSewellUU @GroundworkGM https://t.co/zOfdnhY7DJ

Recent slurry spreading on same farm as last year. On waterlogged ground. Reported last year  to the @EnvAgencySW and I will report again. But what's the point? Ditch system connects to the river close by.  @BristolAvonRT @DJWarburton https://t.co/7XzhG2t69d
